title: Combined Commanders’ Conference: PM Modi arrives at Eastern Command headquarters in Kolkata
content: The conference is the apex brainstorming forum of the armed forces, bringing together the nation’s top civil and military leadership to exchange views at the conceptual and strategic levels

title: Last date of ITR filing today; Income Tax Department says deadline not extended
content: The department urged taxpayers to rely only on updates from its verified handle @IncomeTaxIndia and not to be misled by unverified posts

title: Mumbai drenched on first day of week; heavy rains affect morning commute
content: The heavy downpour, which began around midnight with lightning and thunder, continued in the morning, leading to inundation of low-lying areas like King's Circle and other areas

title: SC to continue Bihar SIR hearing today; Aadhaar accepted as 12th document for SIR | LIVE
content: Previously, Advocate Gopal Sankaranarayanan urged the Supreme Court to direct the ECI to give publicity to the order.

title: Supreme Court to pronounce verdict on stay of Waqf (Amendment) Act 2025 | LIVE
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai had heard the case back-to-back for three days in May, the very same month he took over as top judge

title: Indian Navy gets anti-submarine warfare ship
content: The name ‘Androth’ holds strategic and symbolic significance as it is derived from the Androth Island in the Lakshadweep archipelago, underscoring India’s commitment to safeguarding its vast maritime territories

title: Ilaiyaraaja accepts CM Stalin’s request to set Sangam literature to music
content: Music director A.R. Rahman, in a message, said Mr. Ilaiyaraaja had secured a special place for Tamil Nadu in the world of music. Mr. Rahman said Mr. Ilaiyaraaja’s Symphony would serve as an inspiration to any musician striving for excellence.

title: States should get compensation for GST revenue loss; eco growth should benefit all: Kerala FM
content: Kerala Finance Minister Balagopal emphasises passing on GST benefits to common people and warns of revenue loss impact on States

title: U.S. immigration authorities detain 73-year-old Sikh woman in California; family calls for her release
content: Harjit Kaur, who has lived in the East Bay in Northern California for more than 30 years, was detained by Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials during a routine check-in earlier this week

title: West Bengal records highest child marriages in India at 6.3%, reveals data
content: Even after a decade of dedicated schemes targeting elimination of child marriage in West Bengal like Kanyashree Prakalpa the state records very high incidents of child marriage both in rural and urban areas

title: White-coats walk out in protest: Chhattisgarh’s health workers are on strike
content: For nearly a month, Chhattisgarh health workers have been on strike, demanding permanent employment and better working conditions. This has burdened the already strained healthcare system in the State

title: Defence Ministry unveils new framework to streamline revenue procurement
content: The new manual will ‘foster jointness among the three Services’ and is aimed at achieving self-reliance  in defence sector, said the Defence Ministry

title: Public transport is the only way to tackle traffic congestion, says Hyderabad Metro Rail chief
content: Architects should leverage their technical expertise to develop innovative ideas to tackle population growth, environmental degradation, pollution control and fast-paced urbanisation, says HMR managing director at All India Architecture Reconnect Summit

title: Drive to curb multi-layered plastic waste in the Nilgiris launched
content: As the first step towards identifying the companies that have the biggest footprint in products sold and waste generated as a result, a brand and waste audit has been conducted in Coonoor. The exercise will be done in Udhagamandalam and Kotagiri, too

title: Milad juloos winds through Hyderabad amid prayers and pageantry
content: Young men on two-wheelers, cars, lorries and even camels carried flags that signified the event; chants and slogans of prophethood were raised even as the procession moved towards the designated route

title: Protest turns violent in Manipur’s Churachandpur after police detain two for vandalising Modi cutouts
content: A mob protested near the Churachandpur police station against the detention of the two youths. Soon it turned into a clash between the mob and the security forces. The tension eased after the two were released

title: Sense of superiority based on birth should be continuously challenged, says new CPI State Secretary
content: M. Veerapandian argues that only the continuous inculcation of social science can bring about a meaningful change in society

title: Minority BJP government at Centre will not survive for long: Chief Minister Stalin
content: He says opposition parties have been claiming that the DMK has not fulfilled its poll promises as they are unable to accept that support for his government has been on the rise among the people

title: Residents call for change in ABC rules to curb stray dog menace
content: The council has come forward with a set of demands in the backdrop of the recent Supreme Court verdict allowing State governments to take appropriate action on the stray dog issue across the country

title: Over 3,000 cases settled in national Lok Adalat organised by DLSA in Malappuram
content: Two significant settlements were reached in cases involving loans from a nationalised bank in the district

title: Minister Anam Ramanarayana Reddy releases water from Somasila Reservoir to Penna River
content: The government is preparing plans to set up temple tourism parks across the district as per the orders of the Chief Minister

title: Half a century later, Short Service Officers still await pension justice
content: Emergency and Short Service Commissioned Officers, many now in their 70s and 80s, press on with a legal battle for benefits they say were promised in the 1960s

title: After killing minor children, man ends life and wife rescued
content: Caught in a debt trap over the medical treatment of a man who became bedridden after a road accident four years ago, a couple killed their two minor children and decided to end their lives

title: Ahead of PM’s visit, Tejashwi Yadav makes surprise inspection of Purnia hospital
content: The leader of opposition in Bihar legislative Assembly pointed out that in the GMCH-Purnia, there is no ICU nor the cardiology department and even the trauma centre is not functional.

title: A.P. High Court Chief Justice stresses need to reduce gender discrimination
content: Despite progress over the years, gender discrimination and violence against women and girls have not been fully eradicated, says Justice Thakur

title: Amit Khare appointed Secretary to Vice-President C. P. Radhakrishnan
content: Khare has been serving as Advisor to the Prime Minister since October 12, 2021, handling matters related to the social sector in the Prime Minister’s Office

title: Heavy rains, mudslides disrupt NH29; suspension bridge washed away in Nagaland
content: Landslides along the Mhainamtsii-Pimla road, an alternate route to Kohima, further disrupted vehicular movement

title: Women will shape vision of Viksit Bharat: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla
content: Conference in Tirupati stresses women’s literacy and reforms in legislatures; Andhra Speaker calls for “no work, no pay” for MLAs

title: Internal reservation: Government in back-channel talks to convince nomadic tribes to withdraw protest
content: The govt. is also mulling over a comprehensive special package for the microscopic communities, say sources

title: New CPI(M) committee office in Kannur to house historic ledger
content: The ledger, kept at the party district committee office Azhikodan Samaraka Mandiram, written by comrade Sreenivasan, who became the party office secretary in 1970, stands as a valuable testimony to the party’s legacy

title: Delhi govt. says free bus travel for transgender persons awaits Cabinet approval
content: HC disposes contempt plea but allows petitioner to revive case if proposal is rejected or delayed further

title: Kerala sees over 500 organ pledge registrations in four days
content: Two back-to-back heart transplant surgeries were carried out in Kochi, on September 11 and 13, as organs were harvested from brain-dead patients in Thiruvananthapuram and Kochi

title: Secunderabad records 123 mm as heavy rains batter Hyderabad, trigger waterlogging and traffic chaos
content: Police personnel and HYDRAA teams were deployed across the twin cities to regulate traffic movement and clear waterlogging

title: Five arrested for selling painkiller tablets near Gudiyatham
content: Investigations revealed the gang was selling the tablets for youth and students in the area. Police seized the tablets, syringes and a two-wheeler from them

title: Crucial KPCC meeting to look into ‘Mamkootathil controversy,’ Wayanad organisational issues
content: Conclave takes place against the backdrop of ‘fissures’ within the Congress leadership over Mamkootathil’s suspension from the party. Party may launch revamp of digital media cell at the meet. It will look into developments in Wayanad following the suicide of DCC treasurer N.M. Vijayan

title: Government will not allow YSRCP implement its divisive agenda, asserts Andhra Pradesh Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar
content: Accusing the opposition party of creating discord in society through its social media, he says the government will firmly deal with those vitiating peace

title: Probe finds Parassala SHO responsible for fatal hit-and-run
content: District Police Chief (Thiruvananthapuram Rural) has recommended the suspension of P. Anil Kumar who failed to adhere to proper procedure after the accident. The SHO did not stop to assist the injured person or report the incident immediately

title: India brags about having 1.4 billion people but won't buy one bushel of U.S. corn: Lutnick
content: The United States Commerce Secretary made these comments in an interview when asked whether the U.S. was mismanaging valuable relationships with allies like India, Canada and Brazil with tariffs imposed on these countries

title: ED summons former TMC MP Mimi Chakraborty and actor Urvashi Rautela in 1xBet case
content: The ED had earlier recorded the statements of former Indian cricketer Shikhar Dhawan and Suresh Raina in the same case

title: Respecting the spirit of democracy is every citizen’s foremost duty, says officer
content: Bike rally as part of International Day of Democracy flagged off outside Sri Vijaya Vittala Temple at Hampi in Vijayanagara district

title: Watch: What the National Highway-2 reopening means for Manipur: Ground Report
content: The National Highway-2, which cuts through Kuki-Zo and Meitei areas fractured by ethnic violence since May 2023, is vital for movement of people and essential goods. The Hindu’s Deputy Editor Vijaita Singh reports on the impact of the reopening.

title: National Highway-2 is open but Kuki-Zos and Meiteis are not ready to hit the road yet
content: A central security officer posted at the Kangpokpi check point said, “Some Meitei people may try to travel clandestinely but there is no visible movement of people from the community taking this route. Similarly, the tribal Kuki-Zo people are not travelling towards Imphal valley”

title: Kerala to develop State-specific MOOC platform K-learn for four-year UG programmes
content: Envisaged to address inadequacies of existing MOOC providers, K-learn will provide free, credit-linked online courses

title: Decision on dividing metro rail projects into multiple packages likely on September 19
content: Andhra Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation Limited to take a call on bidders’ plea to allow wider participation; the 46-km Phase-1 metro in Visakhapatnam includes a 20-km double-decker system

title: No uranium contamination in groundwater at Turakapalem, clarifies Health Department
content: The department, as part of preventive measures, has ordered officials concerned to ensure that water is being supplied through tankers in the village

title: Odisha teacher suspended for beating up 31 students for not touching her feet
content: “Students were beaten with a bamboo stick. I personally found several with bruises on their hands. One child had to be given first aid, and a girl even lost consciousness briefly,” says Block Education Officer, who conducted inquiry

title: Ambiguity over Mamkootathil’s Assembly attendance
content: Speaker says there is no word on whether Mamkootathil will attend the Assembly. Congress leaders equivocal over the MLA’s presence in House. LDF places onus on Congress

title: Parliamentary panel suggests licensing requirements for AI content creators
content: Parliamentary Standing Committee on Communications and Information Technology also recommends mandatory labelling of AI-generated content and stronger measures against deepfakes

title: Residents, farmers oppose proposed Indosol, BPCL projects in Nellore district
content: Bharatha Chaitanya Yuvajana chief Ramachandra Yadav announces to go on a hunger strike along with the farmers if there is an attempt to grab their lands in Karedu

title: Priyanka Gandhi seeks explanation over death of Congress functionaries in Wayanad
content: As many as four people committed suicide over the last two years allegedly due to factionalism within the party

title: Sena (UBT) stages protests against India-Pak Asia Cup cricket match
content: Protests held in different parts of Maharashtra; India and Pakistan will face off in Dubai, in the first match between the two sides since the military conflict in May

title: Andhra Pradesh Assembly Speaker advocates mandatory 60-day sessions for better governance
content: Ayyanna Patrudu raises concern over absenteeism in Andhra Pradesh Assembly, noting 11 YSRCP MLAs, including the party leader, frequently skip sessions

title: Takeaways from every NFL Week 2 game: Eagles defeat Chiefs in Super Bowl rematch; Cowboys win in OT
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 2.

title: Debating Week 2 overreactions: We make sense of the Lions, Cowboys, Eagles, Chiefs
content: Do the Cowboys have playoff hopes? What's up with the Super Bowl duo? We sized up Week 2 overreactions.

title: Sources: Burrow could need surgery for turf toe
content: Cincinnati Bengals star quarterback Joe Burrow is dealing with a turf toe injury that could require surgery, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Sunday night.

title: Eagles quiet Chiefs' talk with scoreboard statement
content: The Eagles got the final word during a hotly contested Super Bowl rematch with the Chiefs on Sunday that was intense to the very end.

title: Cowboys sign Clowney to boost depth, says Jones
content: The Cowboys have signed three-time Pro Bowl edge rusher Jadeveon Clowney to a contract, owner Jerry Jones said after the team's overtime win against the Giants on Sunday.

title: Broncos penalty gives Colts second chance, win
content: The Colts snagged a 29-28 victory after kicker Spencer Shrader converted a 45-yard field goal with no time remaining, but only after badly missing a 60-yard attempt that was negated by a Denver personal foul moments earlier.

title: Reign-Racing game halted after DeMelo collapses
content: The Seattle Reign and Racing Louisville abandoned their match in the National Women's Soccer League on Sunday night after a medical emergency involving Racing midfielder Savannah DeMelo.

title: Stewart nets 18, hurts knee in Liberty's G1 win
content: Forward Breanna Stewart scored 18 points before injuring her knee with 3:01 to play in overtime, and the New York Liberty defeated the Phoenix Mercury 76-69 on Sunday in Game 1 of their best-of-three first-round WNBA playoff series at PHX Arena.

title: Raleigh makes more HR history; M's atop AL West
content: Mariners slugger Cal Raleigh hit his 54th home run, tying Mickey Mantle's record for a switch-hitter and passing Javy Lopez's mark for catchers in a season (43).

title: Scheffler secures sixth win in Ryder Cup tuneup
content: Scottie Scheffler closed with a 5-under 67 to win the Procore Championship for his sixth PGA Tour victory of the year.

title: 🏆 Eagles' petty posts top Week 2 trolls
content: The San Francisco 49ers also made sure to poke fun at the New Orleans Saints after winning on the road, topping Week 2's NFL trolls.

title: Joe Burrow out with turf toe: What is it, and what would extended time away mean for the QB, Bengals?
content: Jake Browning helped deliver a win to the Bengals on Sunday, but what's reasonable to expect from the backup?

title: Your guide to Sunday's first-round WNBA playoff games
content: The Lynx, Aces, Dream and Liberty each lead their series 1-0. Here's how they did it, and how New York won in the desert.

title: WNBA playoff surprises: Why Dream, Mercury, more could crash the championship party
content: There's a clear three-team title race. Here's how the other five teams could make deeper runs than expected.

title: Late rally seals Kroger Queen City title for Charley Hull
content: Charley Hull, coming off a runner-up finish in Houston last week as part of the Aramco series on the European tour, took advantage of top-ranked Jeeno Thitikul's final-hole putting meltdown on Sunday to win the Kroger Queen City Championship in Ohio.

title: Ranking Week 2 fantasy football winners and losers and injury impacts from Sunday
content: A summary of Week 2's best and worst fantasy performances, biggest storylines and historical perspective.

title: Fantasy Buzz: Bengals withstand Burrow injury, Lions offense roars
content: Jake Browning stepping in for an injured Joe Burrow and Mac Jones for Brock Purdy highlighted the early window.

title: Manchester derby reaction: How City beat United, Donnarumma and Haaland dazzle, more
content: Man City outclassed Man United in Sunday's derby, fully deserving their 3-0 win. Here's what you need to know from the fun at the Etihad.

title: Liverpool rely on late-game heroics to deliver another win
content: For the fourth straight game, Liverpool left it late for victory. Is that the sign of a Premier League champion?

title: Betting buzz: Derrick Henry stiff-arms betting public
content: It was a popular bet for Derrick Henry to score a touchdown on Sunday, but Baltimore's star RB failed to do so.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Is Carson Beck's stock trending back up at Miami?
content: Is Carson Beck rising in a wild QB class? Does Jordyn Tyson have challengers for WR1? We have updates on NFL draft prospects through CFB Week 3.

title: What is Aspiration, the company behind the Kawhi Leonard deal?
content: Here's what we know about now-defunct Aspiration, the company at the center of the salary cap circumvention accusations.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Barcelona track Palmeiras' Benedetti
content: Arsenal are ready to rival Barcelona for 19-year-old Palmeiras left-back Luiz Benedetti. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 🏈 Ranking NFL QB debuts from Fields to Rodgers
content: Can Justin Fields and Aaron Rodgers sustain their great Week 1 play? Ben Solak stacks the top QB newcomers -- and begs the Giants to hold off on Jaxson Dart.

title: 🤯 Inside Rob Ryan's most surprising move yet
content: Even though Rob Ryan hasn't coached college football in over 25 years, he has already acclimated to life in L.A.

title: ⚾ Why each MLB contender can win the World Series
content: Lack of power? Bullpen holes? Injured stars? Why each contender's biggest weakness will -- or won't -- sink them in October.

title: 🔥 Which CFB coaches are on the hot seat?
content: Who could be on the hot seat? Who are coaching candidates to watch? Our experts explain the current coaching landscape.

title: 🏀 Report links Kawhi's late pay to Clips partner
content: A Clippers limited partner invested $1.99 million in Aspiration nine days before the company made an overdue $1.75 million payment to Kawhi Leonard, according to a report.

title: ↔️ Jags trade RB Bigsby to Eagles for draft picks
content: The Jaguars have traded running back Tank Bigsby to the Eagles for 2026 fifth- and sixth-round picks.

title: 10 tips to help you win your league this season
content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: 'Don't want them to buy Russian oil': Trump asks Europe to 'toughen up'
content: Donald Trump is pressuring European allies to cease purchasing oil from Russia and strengthen their sanctions, deeming current measures insufficient. He has previously criticized China and India for similar actions, even imposing tariffs on India. While urging Nato to sanction China, Trump seems to be pursuing a separate agreement with India, omitting them from his recent criticisms.

title: Passengers stranded mid-journey: Mumbai monorail comes to a halt in Wadala
content: A Mumbai monorail experienced a technical malfunction in Wadala, causing a halt and passenger transfer. Rajesh Ananda Bhojane, Ward Councillor, reported the incident, highlighting a supply issue cited by monorail officials. Bhojane urged government intervention to address the recurring problem. Fire Brigade officials arrived at the scene to start their operation.

title: 'If it’s about Pahalgam, then fight a war': Rashid Latif slams India’s handshake snub
content: The handshake row between India and Pakistan spiraled on Monday, with former captain Rashid Latif delivering a fiery outburst. Urging the Pakistan Cricket Board to lodge an official complaint, Latif accused India of “bringing politics into cricket” after refusing handshakes in Dubai, while Shoaib Akhtar called on India to “show grace” despite praising their win.

title: Google's AI lockdown: Engineers banned from outside tools; monitored daily usage
content: Google is now requiring its software engineers to seek approval before utilizing external AI coding assistants, as the company prioritizes the adoption of its internal AI tools. This directive, outlined in a recent email, aims to boost productivity and maintain control over sensitive data. Google is actively promoting its internal AI coding platform, Cider, and integrating AI usage into job role expectations to compete in the rapidly evolving AI landscape.

title: 77th Annual Emmy Awards 2025: Full and final list of winners
content: The 77th Primetime Emmy Awards at the Peacock Theater celebrated television's finest from June 2024 to May 2025, hosted by Nate Bargatze. Severance led nominations with 27 nods in the drama category, while Hacks aimed to defend its comedy series title. The event also spotlighted 35 first-time nominees, bringing fresh talent to the forefront.

title: Has the ITR filing deadline been pushed beyond Sept 15? What Income Tax dept said
content: The Income Tax Department refuted social media rumors of extending the ITR filing deadline beyond September 15, confirming it remains unchanged. Taxpayers are urged to rely solely on the department's verified handle for updates. Over six crore ITRs have been filed for the Assessment Year 2025-26.

title: 'Covered with ants': Newborn girl buried alive in UP, saved after shepherd spots hand
content: In Shahjahanpur, a newborn girl was miraculously rescued after being found buried alive near the Bahgul river. A shepherd, hearing faint cries, discovered the infant beneath a mound of soil. Police are investigating the deliberate abandonment, reviewing CCTV footage to identify those responsible, while the baby receives critical care at the Govt Medical College due to injuries and weakness.

title: Gemini Nano Banana AI Saree: What it this new trend; How can you create photos
content: Following the Nano Banana AI 3D figurine craze, the 'Banana AI Saree' trend has emerged on Instagram. Users are transforming selfies into 90s Bollywood-style portraits using Google’s Gemini Nano Banana image editing tool. The AI crafts images with chiffon sarees, grainy textures, and golden-hour lighting, mimicking classic Bollywood aesthetics with popular styles like polka-dot and floral sarees.

title: 'Cricket ko political mat banao': Akhtar slams India; backs Salman Agha's protest
content: India's dominant victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025 was overshadowed by a post-match controversy. The Indian team's apparent refusal to shake hands with the Pakistani players sparked outrage, with Shoaib Akhtar expressing his disappointment. This incident highlights the intense geopolitical tensions that continue to fuel the rivalry between the two nations, extending beyond the cricket field.

title: Heavy rain in Mumbai: Orange alert for today; waterlogging, traffic reported
content: Mumbai, Thane, and Raigad faced a red alert as heavy overnight rains caused significant waterlogging, disrupting traffic and delaying local train services. King’s Circle and Matunga market were severely affected, with Colaba recording the highest rainfall at 88.2 mm.

title: With car pickups & fake maps, land sharks net 'Jewar airport investors'
content: Land sharks are luring unsuspecting buyers with the promise of prime real estate near the upcoming Noida International Airport. These fraudulent schemes involve selling plots within YEIDA's notified area without authorization, using deceptive marketing tactics and fake documents. Authorities are cracking down on these illegal activities, urging the public to verify land ownership before investing to avoid being conned.

title: Layoffs & return-to-office: Microsoft CEO admits ‘lack of empathy’
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella acknowledged the need to rebuild trust with employees following layoffs and a return-to-office mandate. He addressed concerns about a perceived lack of empathy and the challenges of remote work, particularly for new hires. Nadella also cautioned staff about future business challenges and the need for renewal.

title: 'Time for being soft is over': Trump reacts to Indian man beheading by 'illegal alien'
content: Donald Trump condemned the beheading of Chandra Nagamallaiah, allegedly by a Cuban "illegal alien" with a prior criminal record, in Dallas, Texas. Trump criticised the Biden administration's immigration policies, claiming the suspect should not have been in the country. He vowed to prosecute the killer to the fullest extent of the law and promised a tougher stance on illegal immigrant criminals if he were in power.

title: Justin Fields injury update: Jets QB forced out early; week 3 availability in doubt
content: New York Jets' quarterback Justin Fields suffered a concussion during the game against Buffalo Bills. He is now under medical observation. His availability for the next game against Tampa Bay Buccaneers is uncertain. Backup quarterback Tyrod Taylor stepped in after Fields' injury. Taylor completed 7 passes and scored a touchdown. The Jets are awaiting Fields' recovery.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex above 81,900
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Monday, While Nifty50 was above 25,100, BSE Sensex was up over 40 points.

title: Lighting up Kolkatas heritage through citizens' initiative
content: Kolkata Restorers, a citizen-led initiative, has illuminated 94 buildings in Kolkata since November 2023 through crowdfunding. Sparked by Mudar Patherya's effort to light Maniktala Market, the movement empowers residents to contribute to preserving their city's heritage. Prominent facades like Raj Bhavan and St. Paul’s Cathedral now glow, showcasing Kolkata's architectural beauty.

title: Charlie Kirk killing: Will Trump revoke visas of foreigners who mocked ally’s death?
content: President Trump is considering revoking visas of foreign nationals who celebrated Charlie Kirk's assassination, labeling them "sick" and "deranged." This follows widespread firings and suspensions of individuals across various sectors for their social media reactions to Kirk's death. Defence secretary Pete Hegseth is also investigating military members and Pentagon associates who mocked or condoned the murder.

title: Engineer's day: Top Images, quotes, wishes, cards & GIFs to share
content: Engineer's Day is celebrated annually on September 15th in India, honoring Sir M. Visvesvaraya and the contributions of engineers worldwide. The day is marked by sharing quotes, wishes, messages, and greetings to appreciate engineers' role in innovation and problem-solving. It acknowledges their vital impact on shaping a better, smarter world through creativity and dedication.

title: Handshake row: Forget Pak, India even snubbed match officials; shut dressing room
content: Following India's dominant victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup, a controversy erupted as the Indian team refused to shake hands with their opponents and match officials. This decision, defended by captain Suryakumar Yadav as a political statement in light of the Pahalgam terror attack, led to a silent protest from Pakistan and a tense aftermath, overshadowing the on-field performance.

title: ‘Friends might have killed my daughter’: JU girl’s death turns suspicious
content: Anamika Mondal, a Jadavpur University student, drowned in a campus pond. Her father suspects foul play and plans to file a murder complaint. He believes her friends forced her to drink alcohol and pushed her into the water. Four students are being questioned. Anamika's parents performed her shraddh and vowed to fight for justice.

title: Stocks to buy: What's the outlook for Nifty for this week? Check top recommendations
content: Stock market recommendations: SBI Securities' Sudeep Shah suggests Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders and Bajaj Finserv as top stock picks for the week starting September 15, 2025. Nifty shows positive momentum, approaching a breakout, with key resistance at 25200.

title: Watch: Emotional farewell to Charlie Kirk at Washington memorial; hundreds mourn
content: A memorial service was held at the Kennedy Centre in Washington, DC, to honour Charlie Kirk, drawing hundreds of mourners. Republican leaders, including Speaker Mike Johnson, Karoline Leavitt, and Tulsi Gabbard, delivered heartfelt tributes, praising Kirk's dedication to freedom and faith. Leavitt urged attendees to continue Kirk's work, emphasizing the importance of family and carrying on his legacy after his tragic assassination.

title: Onus on govt to ensure peace talks, say people in Manipur
content: While PM Modi urged Manipur to reconcile, Meitei and Kuki communities emphasize the government's role in facilitating dialogue to bridge the divide caused by ethnic conflict. Community leaders stress the need for political solutions rather than development packages, highlighting the complexities in achieving reconciliation and lasting peace.

title: A perfect demolition: No contest with bat or ball; India crush Pakistan
content: India demolished Pakistan by seven wickets in Dubai, reducing the so-called arch-rivalry to a mismatch. Kuldeep Yadav and Axar Patel wrecked the Pakistan middle order before Shaheen Afridi’s late blows lifted the Men in Green to 127/9. Abhishek Sharma’s blitz and Suryakumar Yadav's calm 47 not out sealed the chase with ease, amid added drama over India’s post-match handshake snub.

title: One man, six govt jobs — cloned identity scam exposed in UP
content: A massive fraud in Uttar Pradesh's health department has been exposed, revealing how multiple individuals impersonated the same person, "Arpit Singh," across six districts for nine years. These impostors, using forged documents, collectively siphoned off approximately Rs 4.5 crore in salaries.

title: Handshake row escalates: Pakistan cry foul, lodge protest against India in Dubai
content: The India–Pakistan T20I ended in controversy after Suryakumar Yadav refused handshakes, citing solidarity with victims of the Pahalgam terror attack. Pakistan lodged a protest, alleging a breach of sportsmanship, while Salman Ali Agha skipped the presentation.

title: Asia Cup drama: Silent protest! How Pak captain reacted to India's handshake refusal
content: India's decisive victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup was overshadowed by a diplomatic standoff. The Indian team's refusal to shake hands, citing solidarity with victims of the Pahalgam terror attack, led to Pakistan's captain boycotting the post-match ceremony. This incident has amplified political tensions, highlighting the limitations of cricket in bridging divides between the two nations.

title: Charlie Kirk killing: Kin says Tyler's partner 'hates conservatives & Christians'
content: A relative of Tyler Robinson's transgender partner revealed to Fox News Digital that he harbors animosity towards conservatives and Christians, suggesting a potential influence on Robinson's political views. The partner, currently not charged, allegedly exhibited increasing anger and radicalization in recent years. The relative believes the partner significantly influenced Robinson's behavior and views during their year-long relationship.

title: War 2 OTT release: Check timeline, platform for Hrithik Roshan starrer
content: War 2, the YRF Spy Universe film, had a mixed theatrical run. Now, fans await its Netflix release. The expected release window is late September to early October. The film stars Hritik Roshan, Jr NTR, and Kiara Advani. It follows Kabir, a rogue agent, and Vikram, tasked to stop him. Anil Kapoor joins as the new RAW chief.

title: Dramatic 5 minutes in Dubai: Suryakumar snubs Pak's handshake, India shut door on opposition
content: India’s seven-wicket win over Pakistan in Dubai was overshadowed by a handshake controversy. Suryakumar Yadav refused customary pleasantries, calling it a “proper reply” and dedicating the win to victims of the Pahalgam terror attack and the armed forces. Pakistan showed disappointment, with coach Mike Hesson revealing his side was “ready” to engage but left ignored.

title: Loyalty vs morality: Wayne Gretzky’s silence on Trump scandals under lens
content: Wayne Gretzky, celebrated hockey legend, faces scrutiny for his silence amidst the controversies surrounding Donald Trump. Their longstanding friendship raises questions about whether personal loyalty outweighs public responsibility. Critics argue that Gretzky's silence sends a troubling message, while supporters defend his focus on hockey and personal relationships, leaving many to wonder if he will address the controversy.

title: Satellites at risk? Solar flares surge to 108m degrees; astronauts on alert
content: A new study reveals solar flares can reach a staggering 108 million degrees Fahrenheit, six times hotter than previously thought. This discovery resolves a decades-old mystery about broadened spectral lines in flare light, indicating superheated ions. The findings are crucial for refining space weather forecasting, protecting satellites, astronauts, and global communication systems from solar storm hazards.

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: 'Non-cooperative' Tyler Robinson under special watch
content: Tyler Robinson, accused of assassinating Charlie Kirk at a Utah Valley University event, is under special watch for a mental health evaluation. Following a 33-hour manhunt, Robinson was apprehended after his father recognised him in FBI footage and intervened due to suicidal concerns. Governor Brian Cox stated Robinson isn't cooperating, but his family and partner are assisting investigators, noting his deep leftist indoctrination.

title: Watch: 'We stand with victims of Pahalgam' – Gambhir dedicates win to armed forces
content: India defeated Pakistan in the Asia Cup, a victory dedicated to the victims of the Pahalgam attack and in gratitude to the Indian Army for Operation Sindoor. Kuldeep Yadav's stellar bowling performance and Suryakumar Yadav's anchoring innings led India to a dominant seven-wicket win. This victory marked a significant moment, showcasing India's resilience and solidarity.

title: How rare NFL rule became deciding factor in Broncos vs Colts clash
content: Indianapolis Colts defeated Denver Broncos 29-28 in a dramatic finish. A late leverage penalty against Denver proved decisive. Spencer Schrader's winning field goal sealed the victory for the Colts. The penalty call sparked debate among fans and analysts. Broncos coach Sean Payton lamented his team's mistakes. Colts remain unbeaten after this thrilling encounter.

title: Taylor Swift at Arrowhead: From secretive arrival to security concerns
content: Taylor Swift made a low-key entrance at the Kansas City Chiefs' home opener, sparking fan speculation. Unlike her grand Eras Tour arrivals, she discreetly entered behind a screen, avoiding the usual fanfare. This subtle approach highlights Swift's evolving relationship with the public, balancing her star power with a desire for privacy, leaving fans curious about her presence.

title: Will Travis Kelce play today? Injury update; Chiefs vs Eagles game status
content: Travis Kelce is set to play against the Philadelphia Eagles, despite a recent controversy. Kelce expressed frustration after colliding with Xavier Worthy in the previous game against the Los Angeles Chargers, leading to Worthy's injury. Kelce addressed the incident on his podcast, taking accountability for sidelining his teammate. The Chiefs aim to rebound from their loss against the Eagles.

title: "Radicalised Online": Utah Authorities Say Charlie Kirk's Killer Not Cooperating
content: Family and friends of the 22-year-old accused of fatally shooting Charlie Kirk described his politics as veering left in recent years as he spent large amounts of time scrolling the "dark corners of the internet," Utah Gov. Spencer Cox said Sunday.

title: Who Was Chandra Mouli Nagamallaiah, Indian Man Beheaded By Cuban In US
content: Chandra Mouli Nagamallaiah, an Indian man living in the US, was attacked and beheaded by his employee, Cobos-Martinez, after an argument over a broken washing machine last week.

title: "Have To Be Careful": Trump On Israeli Strikes On "Great Ally" Qatar
content: Days after Israel attacked Qatar in an airstrike targeting Hamas leaders, US President Donald Trump made careful remarks Sunday as Washington's two powerful Middle Eastern allies face a worsening rift.

title: 'United' India Proved Winston Churchill Wrong, UK Facing Division: RSS Chief
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said India is moving forward on the path of development by proving everyone's predictions wrong as it is driven by faith in the traditional philosophy of knowledge, action, and devotion.

title: 100 Days Later, US Federal Workers Navigate Wreckage From Musk's DOGE
content: Roughly 100 days after Elon Musk's dramatic departure from the Trump White House, federal workers are still grappling with the lasting damage from his Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).

title: Donald Trump And King Charles: Heads Of State With Opposing Personalities
content: King Charles is 76 years old, the US President Donald Trump 79. They are both wealthy, previously divorced and love Scotland, where Trump's mother was born and Charles spends many holidays.

title: "Kill Them": Fox & Friends Host On "Mentally Ill Homeless People", Apologises
content: Brian Kilmeade, host for the conservative Fox & Friends talk show, apologised on Sunday for stating that homeless mentally ill people should be given lethal injections, saying his remark had been "extremely callous."

title: "Being Soft On Illegal Aliens Over": Trump After Indian Man Beheaded In US
content: US President Donald Trump has reacted to the killing of Chandra Nagamallaiah, the Indian man beheaded by a Cuban migrant last week in Dallas, Texas. He vowed to make "America safe again" and said his administration won't be "soft" on illegal "immigra

title: PM Modi To Visit Bihar, West Bengal Today, A Look At Projects He Will Launch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is on a high-profile visit to West Bengal and Bihar on Monday, where he is inaugurating key infrastructure and developmental projects.

title: Meet Diella, World's 1st AI-Made 'Minister' Tasked With Curbing Corruption
content: Albania has become the world's first country to appoint an 'AI minister' -- not a person to oversee the growth and ethical use of artificial intelligence in the country, but a virtual member of government, made of pixels and code.

title: Sikh Woman In US For Over 30 Years Detained By Immigration Officials
content: A 73-year old Sikh woman has been detained by immigration authorities in California after she went for a routine check-in with the US agency, sparking protests and concerns among her family and members of the community.

title: Supreme Court To Rule On Pleas Against Waqf Amendment Act Today
content: The Supreme Court is slated to pronounce Monday its interim orders on three key issues, including the power to denotify properties declared as "waqf by courts, waqf-by-user or waqf by deed."

title: After Charlie Kirk's Killing, Growing Chorus Of Conservatives Wants His Critics Ostracised
content: After years of complaints from the right about "cancel culture" from the left, some conservatives are seeking to upend the lives and careers of those who disparaged Charlie Kirk after his death.

title: Alleged Charlie Kirk Killer Had 'Leftist' Beliefs, Utah Governor Says
content: The man arrested over conservative influencer Charlie Kirk's assassination was romantically involved with a transgender roommate and had "leftist ideology," Utah's governor said.

title: Keir Starmer Says UK Won't Tolerate Racial Intimidation After Far-Right Rally
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said Britain would not tolerate people feeling intimidated "because of their background or the colour of their skin" after a large far-right protest was marked by battles with police.

title: Navy Receives Indigenously-Built Anti-submarine Warfare Ship 'Androth'
content: The Indian Navy has received an indigenously-built anti-submarine warfare ship that is expected to boost its maritime prowess against the backdrop of China's growing forays into the Indian Ocean.

title: Finance Ministry Deputy Secretary Dies After BMW Hits His Bike In Delhi
content: A senior official of the Union Ministry of Finance died and his wife is seriously injured after a BMW car hit his motorcycle on Ring Road near Delhi Cantt metro station on Sunday, the police said.

title: "India Led The World, But Did Not Conquer Any Country": Mohan Bhagwat
content: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh sarsanghchalak, Mohan Bhagwat, on Sunday highlighted that India led the world 3,000 years ago, but didn't conquer any other country or suppress anyone's trade.

title: Audio Leak Reignites Row Over Congress Leader NM Vijayan's Suicide In Kerala
content: The controversy over the alleged suicide of former District Congress Committee (DCC) treasurer N M Vijayan in this hill district escalated on Sunday with the leak of an audio conversation between his family and Thiruvanchoor Radhakrishnan.

title: Stone-Throwing, Clashes In Manipur's Churachandpur After Arrests Over Vandalism
content: A group of people including teens in Manipur's Churachandpur clashed with the security forces as they sought the release of some of their friends who were arrested in an alleged vandalism case.

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . a 28-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stabbing to death his grandfather near Idinjar junction on sunday . the man is charged with stabbing his grandfather to death .

title: Monsoon starts an early withdrawal from Rajasthan

title: College football betting: Can the Irish still win the national championship?
content: Notre Dame has stumbled out of the gate, but the bigger question is whether those stumbles are cracks in the foundation or simply early growing pains against top-tier competition . what comes next will decide if this season fades into disappointment or transforms into something entirely different .

title: DeShaun Foster is out at UCLA; here's who could take over the Bruins
content: alum deShaun Foster was elevated late in the 2023-24 coaching carousel . the school fired Foster after an 0-3 start in which the Bruins were outscored 108-43 . he is a former assistant and standout running back in the NFL .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Every game in the first round, starting Sunday
content: the WNBA playoffs are finally here . the first round is a 1-1-1 format, with the higher seed hosting Game 1 and Game 3 . if necessary, the finals will expand to a best-of-seven series (2-2-1-1-1) format .

title: AP Week 3 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team

title: Virginia Tech fires Brent Pry: Top candidates, transfers and recruits to watch
content: the Virginia Tech Hokies fired coach Brent Pry after a 0-3 start to the season . Pry was supposed to represent a return to the Frank Beamer glory years in blacksburg . but a bowl game in 2023 and a faceplant to start this season closed the curtain for Pry .

title: After defeating Canelo, is Crawford the best fighter of his generation?
content: Terence Crawford becomes undisputed champion in three weight classes . the 37-year-old beats canelo alvarez unanimously to become super middleweight champion . he enters an exclusive club as the first men's boxer in the four-belt era to earn undisputed status .
